chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L. Davis III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles L. Davis III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Charles L. Davis III was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Charles L. Davis III was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  **Pay fine of $300.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges - each count.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (each Ct).  May Not have contact with Kara M, Nicci B, Gregory B, Tracey C, Susan G, David G, Todd B, Timothy J, Jacob Z  their residences or place of employment.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Charles Bennett.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:10pm-  Matter heard with 13CF1318, 13CF1319 & 14CF7.  Victim rights compliance.  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions on each count concurrent - consecutive to count 1 in 13CF1319.  Court orders $300.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge on each count.  DE to submit DNA sample.  DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $500.00.  Appeal rights given.
from Deborah Cannon    (Copy given to ADA & Attorney Bennett on 6/9/2014)
from Lars Ullberg    (Copy given to ADA & Attorney Bennett on 6/9/2014)
from Chuck Davis    (Copy given to ADA & Attorney Bennett on 6/9/2014)
from Lisa Smith     (Copy given to ADA & Attorney Bennett on 6/9/2014)
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Charles Bennett.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:28pm-  Matter heard with 13CF1318, 13CF1319 & 14CF7.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Bennett is requesting an adjournment to discuss a global resolution w/ the State.  State is requesting a brief recess.  Court takes a brief recess to allow parties to further discuss a possible resolution.  3:10pm-  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 1 & 4; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Charles Bennett.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:28am-  Matter heard with 13CF1318, 13CF1319 & 14CF7.  Victim rights compliance.  State was not aware the DE was transferred to prison & the DE was not writted for today's hearing.  Court adjourns matter to April 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm to allow the DE to be present.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Charles Bennett (in 14CF6 & 14CF7) & Attorney Terry Rose (in 13CF1318 & 13CF1319).  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  2:41pm-  Matter heard with 14CF7, 13CF1318 & 13CF1319.  Victim rights compliance.  Parties stipulate that Attorney Bennett may represent the DE on all cases - so ordered.  Attorney Bennett is requesting an adjournment for reasons set forth on the record.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to February 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Charles Bennett. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by Atty Graveley.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 1-29-14 @ 1:30pm with 13CF1319 and 13CF1318. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

142pm  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: LE  Initial appearance adjourned to 1/7/14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  Temporary $10,000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
